reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Investing for impact to end Tuberculosis and HIV

description.narrative: Ghana - TB/HIV - Ministry of Health of the Republic of Ghana - Ghana Mal-MOH. This program has the following goals: To reduce TB incidence by 25% from 148 in 2018 to 111 per 100,000 population by 2025. To reduce by 35% the 2018 TB mortality rate baseline of 52 deaths per 100,000 population by 2025. To reduce the proportion of TB-affected families who suffer catastrophic cost due to TB from 64% in 2016 to 0% in 2025. To achieve HIV epidemic control and the fast track treatment targets of 90-90-90 by 2023. To reduce new HIV infections by 42% by 2023. The objectives of this program are: To early screen, detect and enrol into treatment 90% of estimated all forms of TB, i.e increase treatment coverage from 33% in 2019 to 90% by 2025. To early detect and enrol into treatment 90% of estimated RR/MDR TB cases among new and previously treated cases by 2025. To attain higher treatment success for all forms of TB from 85% in 2018 to at least 90% by 2025 through improved quality clinical care and community TB care and to attain high treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB from 64% in 2017 to 90% by 2025. To provide latent TB treatment or TB preventive Treatment (TPT) to TB contacts and for PLHIV without active TB. To increase the estimated PLHIV who know their status from 58% in 2019 to 90% by 2023.. To increase the % of people newly diagnosed with HIV initiated on ART from 81% in 2019 to 95% in 2023. To increase the % of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery from 75% in 2019 to 95% in 2023. To increase the % of HIV-exposed infants receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth from 65% in 2019 to 90% in 2023. To increase the % of PLHIV on ART who initiated TB preventive therapy among those eligible during the reporting period to 49% in 2023. To increase ART initiation among HIV-positive KP (MSM) and (FSW) to 95% in 2023. To increase the % of clients on ART who are virally suppressed from 68% in 2019 to 90% by 2023.

title.narrative: Impact indicator for GHA-C-MOH
Number of new HIV infections per 1000 uninfected population
TB/HIV mortality rate per 100,000 population
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
Estimated percentage of children newly infected with HIV from mother-to-child transmission among women living with HIV delivering in the past 12 months
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Outcome indicator for GHA-C-MOH

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed

Percentage of people living with HIV not on ART at the end of the reporting period among people living with HIV who were either on ART at the end of the last reporting period or newly initiated on ART during the reporting period
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a non regular partner
Percentage of sex workers who avoid health care because of stigma and discrimination
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases – Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB as a proportion of all estimated RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a male partner
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Percentage of men who have sex with men who avoid health care because of stigma and discrimination
Coverage / Output indicator for GHA-C-MOH
Percentage of people living with HIV newly initiated on ART who were screened for TB
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART, who have a suppressed viral load at 12 months (<1000 copies/ml)
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
Number of people who were tested for HIV and received their results during the reporting period
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – private/non-governmental facilities
Percentage of adults (15 and above) on ART among all adults living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – community referrals
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Percentage of reporting units reporting no stock-outs of anti-TB drugs on the last day of the quarter
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment

Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake smear microscopy during the reporting period
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Percentage of HIV-exposed infants receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Percentage of children (under 15) on ART among all children living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of people newly diagnosed with HIV initiated on ART
Percentage of pregnant women who know their HIV status
Percentage of HIV-positive results among the total HIV tests performed during the reporting period
Percentage of people living with HIV initiated on ART who are screened for TB in HIV treatment settings
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery
